org.threadly.concurrent
Class VirtualCallable<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.threadly.concurrent.VirtualCallable<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type to be returned from .call()
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>
public abstract class VirtualCallable<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>

This class helps assist in making concurrent code testable. This class is not strictly required, but it makes the TestablePriorityScheduler a drop in replacement instead of having to pass a LockFactory into your code. The alternative to using this class would be to pass a LockFactory into your code. But in addition if the runnable needs to sleep, it must do it on the scheduler or locks.

Field Detail

Constructor Detail

VirtualCallable

public VirtualCallable()
Method Detail

call

public T call(LockFactory factory)
       throws java.lang.Exception
This is the run call that will be called for schedulers aware of VirtualRunnable (currently only TestablePriorityScheduler). This lets us inject a lock factory that works for the given scheduler.

Parameters:
factory - factory to use while running this runnable
Returns:
result from .call()
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - possible thrown from .call()

makeLock

protected VirtualLock makeLock()
Returns a virtual lock for the runnable that makes sense for the processing thread pool.

Returns:
VirtualLock to synchronize on and use with pleasure

sleep

protected void sleep(long sleepTime)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Alternative to Thread.sleep(). This call defaults to the native version or uses a method that makes sense for the running thread pool. You have to use this instead of Thread.sleep() or you will block the TestablePriorityScheduler.

Parameters:
sleepTime - Time to pause thread
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
